verse.name: 1 Peter 5:10
verse.Greek: Ὁ δὲ Θεὸς πάσης χάριτος ὁ καλέσας ὑμᾶς εἰς τὴν αἰώνιον αὐτοῦ δόξαν ἐν Χριστῷ ὀλίγον παθόντας αὐτὸς καταρτίσει στηρίξει σθενώσει θεμελιώσει
verse.ULB: After you suffer for a little while, the God of all grace, who called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will perfect you, confirm you, strengthen you, and establish you.
verse.residue: After you for a little while, the of all , who you to his , will you, confirm you, you, and establish you.

verse.name: 1 Peter 5:11
verse.Greek: αὐτῷ τὸ κράτος εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας ἀμήν
verse.ULB: To him be the dominion forever and ever. Amen.
verse.residue: To him be the and ever. Amen.

verse.name: 1 Peter 5:12
verse.Greek: Διὰ Σιλουανοῦ ὑμῖν τοῦ πιστοῦ ἀδελφοῦ ὡς λογίζομαι δι᾽ ὀλίγων ἔγραψα παρακαλῶν καὶ ἐπιμαρτυρῶν ταύτην εἶναι ἀληθῆ χάριν τοῦ Θεοῦ εἰς ἣν στῆτε
verse.ULB: I regard Silvanus as a faithful brother, and I have written to you briefly through him. I am exhorting you and I am testifying to you that what I have written is the true grace of God. Stand in it.
verse.residue: I regard as a , and I have written to you briefly through him. I am you and I am to you that what I have written is the of . Stand in it.

verse.name: 1 Peter 5:13
verse.Greek: Ἀσπάζεται ὑμᾶς ἡ ἐν Βαβυλῶνι συνεκλεκτὴ καὶ Μάρκος ὁ υἱός μου
verse.ULB: The woman who is in Babylon, who is chosen together with you, greets you. Also Mark, my son, greets you.
verse.residue: The woman who is in , who is together with you, you. Also , my , greets you.

verse.name: 1 Peter 5:14
verse.Greek: Ἀσπάσασθε ἀλλήλους ἐν φιλήματι ἀγάπης Εἰρήνη ὑμῖν πᾶσιν τοῖς ἐν Χριστῷ
verse.ULB: Greet one another with a kiss of love. \p May peace be to you all who are in Christ.
